description: This is another portion of the large and otherwise un-interesting warehouse.  Here
you see that lined up along the padded walls are boxes of various sizes.  Apon
closer inspection of these boxes you see that all of these are labeled "Explosives".
Which explanes why the floor and walls are padded.  The people that work here don't
want any of the explosives to detonate if they fall and hit a hard surface, which
some just might.
25439.name: Southeast Corner of the Warehouse

description: The entire room here is painted floor to ceiling in a large map of the
known world.  Specific areas are marked with colored flags to correspond
with the records of the area,  plants found there, rainfall,
temperatures, and growing seasons.  A small overworked man is sleeping
on a pile of maps, obviously overworked.
25408.name: Map and Chart Room

description: You walk along the station.  The place is huge, pillars hand down
holding the superstructure above, the TriPower Complex Tower.  The
station is very dark, and dirty.  Trash rolls around the station, and
bums walk around picking through that trash.  To the north, you see
the ticket booth, and a smaller room to the east.  To the platforms
are to the west, and the way out of this place is south.
{RPlatform:{r West{x
{RTicket Booth:{r North North{x
{RSeating Area:{r North{x
25624.name: {RT{rri{Bp{bower {CG{crand {CC{central {*- {RM{riddle {RP{rlatform{x

description: This is where all the imported and exported
goods are inspected to make sure no illegal goods are
passing through the Tri-Power area. You see an
inspector looking at all of the stuff. Several men
carry in a large crate, and the inspector scans it
with a magic wand. He nods his head, and the men carry
the crate out of the room. You have an odd feeling
that if you hold very still, he'll inspect you too.
The exits are east and west to warehouse-type rooms,
north to an office, or south to the entrance.
25416.name: Customs Office

25700.name: Entrance to the Dept. of Magic

description: This is the Basement of the Tripower tower.  It looks as if no one
has been here for a long time.  Many spider webs gather in every
corner available.  It smells of old water and mildew, not a fun place
to be.
25615.name: {RT{rri{Bp{bower {CC{complex {RT{rower {cBasement{x

description: This room is very sparsely furnished, a lone desk sits here with an
adding machine, a picture of a man and his family.  He holds his wife close
and the children stand in front smiling, and an urn sits wrapped with a
single black ribbon across it.  A chilling cold permeates this room, making
it uncomfortable to stay long.
25510.name: Office Of {!R{1oads {2& {!B{1ridges {BBudget

description: {*| {RT h e  T r i P o w e r  S t a t e {*|
{*|    {gThe TriPower Tower Complex     {*|
You stand infront of the imfamous {RT{rri{RP{rower {&C{*omplex {&T{*ower{x, the
center point of the {RT{rri{RP{rower{x Nation.  The building stands 20 stories
tall, stretching towards the heavens as a reminder of {Yp{yo{&w{ye{Yr{x.  The
sides of the building are made from a {*dark gray {&stone{x, smooth, and
sleak.  Around the center of the main tower, you see the famous 4 Bars
of the TriPower, extending out away from the building.  {GM{gakou {GG{ga{Gs{x
{Rf{rl{Yam{re{Rs{x burn quietly within tubes of glass, outlining the 4 bars,
causing them to send a green glow over the city.  The grand lobby of
the tower is to the north, and the large steps of the tower extend to
the east and west.
25000.name: {*T{yh{&e{x {*S{yte{&ps{x {*o{yf {*T{yh{&e{x {c[{RT{c]{rri{Bp{bower {c[{MC{c]{momplex {c[{RT{c]{Bower{x

description: All around you see huge crates and boxes filled
with stuff to be sold in other countries. You feel
amazed at the junk some people are willing to buy. You
see three workers hauling crates with a donkey. The
exits are back west to the customs office, or further
into the exports warehouse.
25419.name: Beginning of Exports Warehouse

description: You are standing in the southeast corner of the council room.  You
see that this room is pretty plain except for the many displays that
are around here.  You see a manaquin dressed in full Legion gear, and
as you look closer you swear that it is looking back at you.  You see
many paintings of the marvelous inventions that the Department of
Science has created and even a model of an Airship is hanging from
the ceiling.
25465.name: Southeast Corner

description: You are standing in a lavish hallway.  It appears as though no expense was
spared in building this portion of the tower.  The walls are painted a pale
white and are decorated with tapestries and paintings of the Tri-Powers
greatest achievements.  The floor is laid out with thick pile carpeting,
which in itself has a distinct picture with the Bloodstoner's symbol.
You see a young woman here taking peoples cloaks and giving out return
tickets.
25980.name: Hallway to the Council Room

description: The Tripowerian Congress is home of the people's government of the
Tripower Kingdom.  The congress is made up of members called senators,
who help the government rule themselves.  The Congressional Room on
the 9th floor of the Tripower Tower is a large circular room built on
tiers.  The Podium that stands in the center of the room is sunk in,
while the Senator's Desks that circle the podium slowly rise tier per
tier as it extends away from the center.  The outter walls are carved
into pillars which meet up in a central dome.  South of the central
podium is a walkway leading to the tower elevators.
25231.name: {R[ {7T{Ch{7e {YIl{ylu{7mi{cna{*ti {R] {CS{cenator {CS{ceats{x

description: The Tripowerian Congress is home of the people's government of the
Tripower Kingdom.  The congress is made up of members called senators,
who help the government rule themselves.  The Congressional Room on
the 9th floor of the Tripower Tower is a large circular room built on
tiers.  The Podium that stands in the center of the room is sunk in,
while the Senator's Desks that circle the podium slowly rise tier per
tier as it extends away from the center.  The outter walls are carved
into pillars which meet up in a central dome.  South of the central
podium is a walkway leading to the tower elevators.
25247.name: {R[{C Church of Player {R] {CS{cenator {CS{ceats{x

description: You are standing in the southwest corner of the council room.
The walls here are the same pale white and is well lit.  You
see a scaled model of Torregiano in all its glory.  The
detail on the model is marvelous, even the lights in the
buildings light up on when a switch is hit.  To the north
you see the beginning of this sides seats, and you notice
that the meeting is about to begin so you had better get yours
while you still can.
25466.name: Southwest Corner

description: The Electricty is now flickering on and off due to the high amount of
electricity coming within the east wall.  Many fits of mad laughter is also
heard above the humming sound.  Hmmmnn....
25648.name: The Hallway

description: You have entered the office of an executive of the TriPower.  The
skylight windows to your north allow you to see the city lights and the
people walking down below.  A large mahogany desk is neatly arranged with
contact lists and checks.  The executive sits on a comfortable leather
chair, and mostly talks to other bankers on the phone.  The only exit is
south.
25111.name: A More Spacious Office

description: {x
{x  Bolted to the marble walls of the Tripower Tower
Complex stands carved from Materia, green blocks
forming the Tripower's famed Four Bars.  On either
side of the massive bars burns a torch, allowing the
symbol to shine over the great city of Torregiano in
the light of day and night.
25191.name: {GS{gouth-{GF{gace {&of the {RT{rri{Bp{bower {GT{gower{x

description: A large marble table sits here amid twelve executive, plush chairs.  A
look out the window shows a picture perfect view of the city below, and the
moutains streching away to the east.  A passing Airship can be seen just off
to the east, probably on patrol of the road to Vectnor.  A well stocked bar
in on the northern wall of the room, and a Portrait of President Bloodstoner
overlooks the Chair at the head of the table.
25513.name: Private Conference Room

description: This is the Lethal Injection chamber.  The floor and walls are all stone
as is the celing.  There is a large chair in the middle of the room with a
tray next to it.  Looking at the tray you see many surenges on it, most
labeled with the leter X.
25634.name: The Lethal Injection Chamber.

description: You have walked onto the southern edge of the printing floors, where the
TriPower money is actually made.  Workers put large sheets of paper into
metal slots, from there, the paper is stands with the tripower seal.  After
that the paper is cut into many different slices, and those are each
stamped.  The little slices are collected by still more people.  The only
exit is north.
25121.name: The Mint

description: You are stand in the middle of a long halway with that leads to the jail cells in
the tower.  The walls are a really dark gray, which was designed to make the place
gloomy.  However, the hallway and the jail cells are lit by lamps of pale green light.
25452.name: Federal Jail Cells

description: You walk into a {&little {*section{x in the corner of the store.  You see
that one wall is covered in tiny {ylittle {Yshelves{x.  All diffrent types
of shoes line the {ylittle {Yshelves{x, from walking shoes to running shoes,
and even {Rco{rmb{Rat {Ybo{yo{Yts{x.  The store continues to the north and west.
25043.name: {*The {YG{yr{&a{yn{Yd {RS{rtore {CE{Bast{c [Shoes]{x

description: This medium sized four walled room, is no more elaborate than the rest.
It still has the same white walls, but the floors have been replaced
with pine floorboards.  The room is poorly decorated, a small plaque,
the {!D{1o{!M {xcrest, and a large oak desk are the only things that
have been placed about the room.
25314.name: {&T{7he {!D{1o{!M {&O{7ffice{x

description: Bright flowers fill this glassed in room.  It is also very hot in
here.  A handful of green elves run about watering the flowers,
transplanting seedlings, and mixing dirt for future use.  One elf
sorting through seeds tries to explain what is going on the the heat is
getting unbearable.
25403.name: Green House

description: You stand on the threshold of a gigantic room
filled with all the good brought into the country.
Boxes and crates are stacked to the ceiling. You are
amazed by all the things imported by the Tri-Power
government. You see some guys carrying stuff east to
the Customs Office. To the south and west is the rest
of this warehouse.
25423.name: Beginning of the Import Warehouse

description: This large underground room is filled with desks and maps of the
rail systems which run underneath the city of Torregiano.  This office
is responsible for the timely manor that the trains within the city
run, along with all traffic going to Westbridge, New Thalos and other
towns and cities south of the Tripowerian city.  Service ends in
Lucullus at the Vectorian Border.  This office is controlled by the
Tripower Department of Transportation.
25004.name: {RT{rri{Bp{bower {CG{crand {CC{central {GO{gffices{x

description: This is the Department Leaders office, rather large and well
decorated.  A large maple desk is here, rather empty.  A high back chair
is behind it.  Paintings and plaques line the walls.  A few maps are
laying out pointing out farms and forests about the tripower area.
There is only once window, it looks out over Torregiano, a rather
calming view.  Who ever uses this office, doesnt work much.
25410.name: Dept. of Agricultures Head Office

description: You are standing in a hallway that leads towards the Public Cafateria.  The walls
here are made of stone blocks that are cemented together, and is painted a pale
blue to give the place a more homely look.  The floor is layed with carefuly placed
tile that is pearly white and has an almost blinding shine to them, giving the
impression that it is cleaned, and kept clean regularly.
25427.name: Entrance to the Public Cafateria

description: You walk along the {*The {yB{&ac{yk {RH{rall{Rs{* of the {YT{yo{&w{ye{Yr{x.  To the south the
hallway goes towards the {YG{yr{&a{yn{Yd {RS{rtore{x.  The hallway continues its way
to the east, leadind around the elevator and the other side of the
{YG{yr{&a{yn{Yd {RS{rtore{x.
25041.name: {*The {yB{&ac{yk {RH{rall{Rs{* of the {YT{yo{&w{ye{Yr{x

description: You walk into a small area, which is the {YTr{*av{Yel {RSec{rt{Rion{x.  A large
round counter stands in the {&corner{x, behind it a {Gmap{x of the known world
hangs.  A few chairs line the area here, a waiting area for some
people.  A lady stands behind the counter, dressed up in one of the
{YTr{*av{Yel{x {YAg{yen{Ycy{x uniforms.  A door behind her reads "{yEm{Yploy{yee's {RO{rnl{Ry{x".
25044.name: {*The {YG{yr{&a{yn{Yd {RS{rtore {CE{Bast{c [Travel]{x

Tripower Kingdom.  The congress is made up of members called senators,
who help the government rule themselves.  The Congressional Room on
the 9th floor of the Tripower Tower is a large circular room built on
tiers.  The Podium that stands in the center of the room is sunk in,
while the Senator's Desks that circle the podium slowly rise tier per
tier as it extends away from the center.  The outter walls are carved
into pillars which meet up in a central dome.  South of the central

description: The warmth of the sun gently fills this room with a peaceful A
beautifully carved arch made of mithril casting and hellinite stone
accents the entrance to the northern promenade and another hallway.
The floors shimmer as the miniature trees on the promenade sway in the
breeze and alter the shadows.  Purple obsidian statues line the hall
to the west and lead to an oak door at the end.
25079.name: The Northwestern Hall

description: You stand on a southern platform.  Before you stands the train
platform.  You see the train tracks below you, running into the
underground tunnels of the station.  The platform seems to go in
either direction.  Pillars line the platforms just east of here, and
pass the pillars is the station.
{RElevator:{r East-South{x
25622.name: TriPower TrainStation Platform [B]

description: As you step into this room, you are nearly
overwhelmed by the smell of garlic. You see a large
pile of sharp wooden stakes in the corner. You
accidentaly bang your head on a lantern hanging from
the ceiling. It has a logo that says "Mako Gas-Light
Co." On a desk there is a black bag filled with
surgical instruments. Shelves are lined with severed
body parts pickled in some strange chemical. On an
operating table, there is a dead body. It has two
round bite marks on its neck, and has a stake through
its chest.
25418.name: The workshop of the Impaler

description: This Seems to be a waiting room of some sort.  Many people sit in chairs
here, crying, sobing, or just sitting there solemly know what is about to
happen.  As the lights flicker and dim, a large hum of electricity is heard
and a scream is emitted.
25627.name: The Wating room.

description: The Tripowerian Congress is home of the people's government of the
Tripower Kingdom.  The congress is made up of members called senators,
who help the government rule themselves.  The Congressional Room on
the 9th floor of the Tripower Tower is a large circular room built on
tiers.  The Podium that stands in the center of the room is sunk in,
while the Senator's Desks that circle the podium slowly rise tier per
tier as it extends away from the center.  The outter walls are carved
into pillars which meet up in a central dome.  South of the central
podium is a walkway leading to the tower elevators.
25244.name: {R[{C Emirc Dezinargo Syndicate {R] {CS{cenator {CS{ceats{x

description: You stand within the center of the library, all around you the
bookcases stand, lined up against each wall.  Here in the center of
the library, a large scale model of Torregiano stands, in every detail
of the plans made for Torregiano.  You see the current city, and two
large expansions on either side.  Smaller cannons are mounted on the
expansions, sticking out and aiming north.
25204.name: The Center Of The Library

description: On top of the world is what some people might call this place.  Not
many structures in the Great Realms stretch this high into the skies.
One of the few starting accomplishments of the Tripower Kingdom.
Below stands forth the city of Torregiano, from the grassy plains in
the south stretching to the mountains, or the great sea-port and Istar
Sea to the north.  Even the great Makou Cannon is below this roof
line, only by several feet though.  Far off to the north on a dark
night, the lights of St.  Plattsburg can be seen on the horizon, and
beyond it Vector City.  To the southwest of the city, almost like a
green beacon the flaming sign of Makou City appears within the
mountains.  Beyond it the Elven Valley and city of Westbridge.
25184.name: {BThe {CR{coof{B Of The {RT{rri{Bp{bower {RT{rower{x

description: A dark and damp passage cut through solid rock heads west.  A large
iron door guards it from the outside.
25003.name: {*A Secret Passage{x

description: You are in a small jail cell that is just big enough for a cot, some floor space for
excersizing and a privy.  You notice that the only window in this room is the one
located on the door, but that is barred so to keep the criminals in.  The walls are
made of solid concrete and are padded to prevent injury to ones self.
25449.name: Jail Cell: 13 Bravo

description: A large oak table fills most of this room.  Chairs surround the table,
and a single high back chair waits at the table head for the department
leader.  A smaller table is pushed against the wall, waiting with a
plateful of pastries and a pot of coffee.  Any meetings about
Agriculture take place here, as rare as they are.
25409.name: Meeting Hall

description: You stand in the Office of Citizen's Relations.  A large counter lines
the southern wall.  Several people stand behind it, talking to people.
There are also serveral lines infront of the people behind the counter,
waiting to speak to them.  The room is a light gray, with white ceilings.
Chairs lines the walls with people waiting.  A hallway is to the east.
25301.name: Office Of Citizen's Relations

description: The bookcase here has a few daggers and needles in it.  You see the
bookcase that holds the knowledge of ancient and modern weapons used
in the realms, the main weapon being the sword.
25213.name: <Library> Weapons Technology

description: The Tripowerian Congress is home of the people's government of the
Tripower Kingdom.  The congress is made up of members called senators,
who help the government rule themselves.  The Congressional Room on
the 9th floor of the Tripower Tower is a large circular room built on
tiers.  The Podium that stands in the center of the room is sunk in,
while the Senator's Desks that circle the podium slowly rise tier per
tier as it extends away from the center.  The outter walls are carved
into pillars which meet up in a central dome.  South of the central
podium is a walkway leading to the tower elevators.
25277.name: {R[{C Merchants of Sembia {R]{x {CS{cenator {CS{ceats{x

description: You see more of the same; the continuing
warehouse filled with crates and boxes from all over
creation. You puzzle over several large jugs of
perfume having tags that say "The smell of Air." Now
who would buy that?
25426.name: More of the Import Warehouse

description: The Tripowerian Congress is home of the people's government of the
Tripower Kingdom.  The congress is made up of members called senators,
who help the government rule themselves.  The Congressional Room on
the 9th floor of the Tripower Tower is a large circular room built on
tiers.  The Podium that stands in the center of the room is sunk in,
while the Senator's Desks that circle the podium slowly rise tier per
tier as it extends away from the center.  The outter walls are carved
into pillars which meet up in a central dome.  South of the central
podium is a walkway leading to the tower elevators.
25230.name: {R[{C Vectorian Citizens Empire {R] {CS{cenator {CS{ceats{x

description: Twenty stories below the city of Torregiano moves about, almost in
an ant like fasion.  The southern face of the tower lies below, almost
unseen unless someone is willing to lean over the side of the roof to
see.  Directly below lies the Tripower Plaza.  Far south past the wall
and grassy plains lies the Southern Mountains.
25186.name: {BThe {GS{gouthern {GE{gdge{B of the {CR{coof{x

description: The tower is constructed from a dark grey marble,
carved from the lands of Deva, known for its valuable
minerals.  Each giant block was set in place with a
series of pullies and chains, lifted from the ground
below, weighing over several tons.  Cranes could now
make this job simple, but the tower was built while
the Tripower was young, along with technology.
25224.name: Above the {RT{rri{Bp{bower {GP{glaza{x

description: This hallway runs North to South, it is long, high ceilinged, and
is built with the same standard white walls, marble floor as the rest
of the building.  The floor and walls themselves appear to be giving
off more than enough light to comfortably see.
25322.name: {&N{7orthern {&H{7allway{x

description: You are standing in the northwest corner of the Council room.
This area is filled with seats that are well decorated and
well padded for those long gruelling council meetings.
From here you can see almost everything. You can see back
to the entrance and see people trying to cram into the hall.
You can also barely see the model of the city that you saw
earlier to the south.
25468.name: Northwest Corner

description: This is the Basement of the Tripower tower.  It looks as if no one
has been here for a long time.  Many spider webs gather in every
corner available.  It smells of old water and mildew, not a fun place
to be.
25606.name: {RT{rri{Bp{bower {RT{rower {CJ{canitors {CO{cffice{x

description: You are standing in the northeast corner of the council room.
You see that the benches here are angled off the other set to
make the line have a more u-shape to it, and that they are
richly decorated.  As you get ready to take a seat you notice
that the meeting has started and that everyone has become very
quiet to listen in on the meeting.
25463.name: Northeast Corner

description: You see more crates and boxes of stuff to be
exported to other countries. Most prominent are
several large, bright green barrels that have writing
on them. The writing says "Makou gas. Handle with
care." You notice that one of the barrels is cracked
and is leaking glowing green goo.
25422.name: More of the Exports Warehouse

description: This is the northwest corner of the warehouse.  Here you see a bunch of filing
cabinets that are lined up along the wall, some of the cabinets are labeled classified
and are henceforth locked.  Others, however, aren't marked and are unlocked, but they
just contain random research notes, and aren't anything that you can make heads or
tails of them.
25442.name: Northwest Corner of Warehouse

description: You have entered the department of city leaders.  There is a large
bulletin board on the white painted wall ahead of you.  It seems to state
the names of the city leaders of the TriPower citys.  A few politicians and
secretarys walk past you now and again, but mostly this hall is pretty
quiet.  East and west you can see a huge hall which leads to the different
City Leader's offices.
25122.name: The Department of City Leaders

description: The tower is constructed from a dark grey marble,
carved from the lands of Deva, known for its valuable
minerals.  Each giant block was set in place with a
series of pullies and chains, lifted from the ground
below, weighing over several tons.  Cranes could now
make this job simple, but the tower was built while
the Tripower was young, along with technology.
25196.name: {GS{gouth-{GF{gace {&of the {RT{rri{Bp{bower {GT{gower{x

description: This small section of the station is the only safe spot.  Some
plastic seats in rows stands here, allowing people to sit down.  The
room is brightly lited, but cutoff from the main station.  The walls
are covered in papers, and you see some doors.  To the north a strange
smell leaks out of the room.
25614.name: {RT{rri{Bp{bower {CG{crand {CC{central {*- {RS{rtation {RL{rounge{x

description: A sign hangs from the ceiling that says "Now
entering the Import/Export Area. This corner of
beauracracy ruled and designed by Arkady. All hail the
Tri-Power!!" Somehow, you are not amused by this. You
can go south, back the way you came, or press on to
the north.
25415.name: Entrance hallway.

description: This hallway runs North to South, it is long, high ceilinged, and
is built with the same standard white walls, marble floor as the rest
of the building.  The floor and walls themselves appear to be giving
off more than enough light to comfortably see.
25313.name: {&S{7outhern {&H{7allway{x

description: The thick oak doors to this room lie open, clearly no session is
taking place regardless of what the sign reads.  The room is lined
with emmense bookshelves filled with enormous texts on laws,
admiralty, civil regulations, and the like.  A long table large enough
to seat 25 destiguished gentlemen rests at the center of this large
room.
25078.name: Conference Room

description: Welcome to the {*The {YG{yr{&a{yn{Yd {RS{rtore {CW{Best{x, the most {Yexp{yens{Yive{x place to buy
{RA{rrmo{Rr {*& {MAcc{messor{Mies{x in Torregiano.  You see inside the {rstore{x, which
has been done in {&dark brown/{*gray {-c{-o{-l{-o{-r{-s{x.  Single {Gg{ga{Gs {gli{Gg{ghts{x from above
shine down on the {*floor{x, showing off each of the sections.  Back east
is the {YT{yo{&w{ye{Yr{x Lobby.
25005.name: {*The {YG{yr{&a{yn{Yd {RS{rtore {CW{Best{c Entrance{x

description: Finally the humming sound stops.  The smell of Roasted flesh seeps
through the walls but many people are laughing!  What kind of sick and
demented people would be laught at a time like this?!?!
25647.name: The Hallway.

description: The Tripowerian Congress is home of the people's government of the
Tripower Kingdom.  The congress is made up of members called senators,
who help the government rule themselves.  The Congressional Room on
the 9th floor of the Tripower Tower is a large circular room built on
tiers.  The Podium that stands in the center of the room is sunk in,
while the Senator's Desks that circle the podium slowly rise tier per
tier as it extends away from the center.  The outter walls are carved
into pillars which meet up in a central dome.  South of the central
podium is a walkway leading to the tower elevators.
25234.name: {R[{C Keepers of Antiquity {R] {CS{cenator {CS{ceats{x

description: You walk along the station.  The place is huge, pillars hand down
holding the superstructure above, the TriPower Complex Tower.  The
station is very dark, and dirty.  Trash rolls around the station, and
bums walk around picking through that trash.  This is almost the
center of the station.  The southern wall is to the south, and the
elvator to the southeast.  The platforms are to the west, and more of
the station north.  To the east you see the station dips in, and you
see a door to the north.
25619.name: {RT{rri{Bp{bower {CG{crand {CC{central {*- {RS{routh {RP{rlatform{x

description: This is the east wing of floor 5.  You stand in a small hallway, to the
south is a door reading "Dept.  Of Citizen's Relations".  There are chairs
lines against the wall and a small table in the middle of the room.  Sounds
from the south make you think the office is busy.  The elevator is west.
25300.name: East Wing Floor 5

description: This Seems to be a waiting room of some sort.  Many people sit in chairs
here, crying, sobing, or just sitting there solemly know what is about to
happen.  As the lights flicker and dim, a large hum of electricity is heard
and a scream is emitted.
25936.name: The Wating room.

description: {x
{c####{&LLLLLLLLKKjjWW{c######{RGG{c####{RDDDD{c####{RDDDD{c####{RDDEE{c####{RLL{c######{&KKLLWWGGGGDDEEKK{c####
{c##{&jjttttttiiGGttWW{c######{RGG{c####{RDDDD{c####{RDDDD{c####{RDDEE{c####{RLL{c######{&KKiiLL;;;;;;;;iiGG{c##
{x  A large stone podium stands in the center of the circular room, this is where
the speakers address congress.  Beyond the stone podium are small desks which create
a circle pattern around the center of the room, these are the Seats of the Senate.
25241.name: {CT{che {RPo{rdi{Rum {cof the {RT{rri{Bp{bowerian {RC{ron{Bg{bress{x

description: This is the 20th Floor of the Tripower Complex Tower.  To the east
is the doors leading to the Office of Lord Bloodstoner, ruler and
president of the Tripower Empire.  A large hallway leads to the east,
passing the doors of the President's Office to the other staircase.
Large windows look out to the south over the waiting room below.
25089.name: The 20th Floor [West]

description: The herbal studies room is for the study of beneficial herbs and
plants.  An apothecary is working here crushing dried roots, leaves and
who knows what else.  The main purpose is to look for beneficial healing
agents within the plant, however, sometimes that is not always the
case.  This room will be used to study the plant discovered earlier,
what was it called....cannabis?
25405.name: Herbal Studies

description: The tower is constructed from a dark grey marble,
carved from the lands of Deva, known for its valuable
minerals.  Each giant block was set in place with a
series of pullies and chains, lifted from the ground
below, weighing over several tons.  Cranes could now
make this job simple, but the tower was built while
the Tripower was young, along with technology.
25199.name: {GS{gouth-{GF{gace {&of the {RT{rri{Bp{bower {GT{gower{x

description: This room is cluttered with maps lying all about, some where under it all
you suspect there is a desk.  But you can't prove it.  A little man darts
from one map to the next then throws it to the side,, and moves to the next
map ...  He seems to be looking for someplace ....  You hear him mumble
"Sacrifice"
25501.name: Office of Maps

description: You stand at the western end of the hallway.  The room looks pretty much the same,
except there is a wall blocking you from going west.  The yellow line that you saw
earlier ends a few feet from the wall, indicating any prisoners to stop.  To the
north and south you see a couple more jail cells.
25450.name: Western Cell Block

description: The bookcases here are stuffed with papers, and small books.
Infront of the bookcase, you see a large table, with a map of the
northern area, between the Tripower and Vector.  Some little figures
are placed on the map, and some lines are drawn in.
25201.name: <Library> Ancient War Plans

description: You are now in the cafateria, well, the part of it where everyone stuffs their face
anyway.  The ceiling is a good distance up, which creates an echo as the people
noisily chatter during their breaks.  There are large tables neatly orientated to give
for maximum capacity.  The entire cafateria is lit by several lamps that give off a
pale green light.
25429.name: The Center of the Cafateria

description: A large ladder opens up in the rock floor, leading deeping into the
belly of the city.  The only exit out of here is the dark passage to
the east.
25607.name: {*A Secret Passage: The Ladder{x

description: This portion of the War & Weapons warehouse houses numerous weapons racks both along
the walls and in the center of the room.  You notice that each rack contains a
different type of weapons.  The floor is made of concrete and is covered by plush
carpet so that in case any of the weapons fall, they don't get damaged.
As you look up toward the ceiling you see a series of lights emitting a blue glow,
this blue glow lights up the entire room and also highlights the serial numbers
that are etched on some of the weapons.
25438.name: Northeast Corner of the Warehouse

description: A small passageway leads from the closet below upwards to what can
be seen is a small hallway.  The ladder itself is only about a story
long.
25182.name: Climbing the Ladder

description: You are standing at the start of the eastern benches for the
council room.  The benches here have the same lavish decor as
the rest of the hall.  The floor, much like the otherside, is
tiled to make it easy to clean.  As you look ahead you see that
all the benches are connected together to form a horseshoe
around the center of the room, where the department heads and
the president, or his representative, meet to cover the
necessary happenings in the realms.
25464.name: Eastern Section of the Audience

description: You are standing inside a glass room.  The environment is extremely humid and the air
almost has a sweet smell to it.  Racks of vials of liquids bearing labels such as
poisonous, or airborne disease.  As you look around you notice that everyone who
works in here is wearing a bio-suit to keep from getting poisoned or diseased.
25443.name: Inside a Glass Room

25269.name: On The End Of The Barrel

description: You are in a room with a vast ceiling and huge
shelves. The shevles are piled to the ceiling with
junk to be sold in other countries. You see
gift-wrapped pieces of glowing rock with tags that say
"One Genuine Piece of Ragnarok. Get it quick before it
and Westbridge are gone (offer limited while supplies
last.)"
25420.name: The Exports Warehouse

description: You are in the southeast portion of this warehouse.  This place is a mess.  There
are boxes piled all over the place, some marked classified, this side up, or Caution:
Explosive.  You notice that to the west there is a room with glass walls and a
seperate ventilation system.  You see a glass door with a sign next to it that
says, "Biological Hazard:  Room contains toxic fumes and a few airborne diseases."
25444.name: Southeast Corner of Warehouse

description: The Tripowerian Congress is home of the people's government of the
Tripower Kingdom.  The congress is made up of members called senators,
who help the government rule themselves.  The Congressional Room on
the 9th floor of the Tripower Tower is a large circular room built on
tiers.  The Podium that stands in the center of the room is sunk in,
while the Senator's Desks that circle the podium slowly rise tier per
tier as it extends away from the center.  The outter walls are carved
into pillars which meet up in a central dome.  South of the central
podium is a walkway leading to the tower elevators.
25248.name: {R[ {RK{rn{*i{&g{*h{rt{Rs {*o{&f th{*e {cS{*h{&ie{*l{cd{x {R] {CS{cenator {CS{ceats{x

description: This is the hallway of Capital punishment.  The walls are stone as are
the floor and celing.  You are startled by the sound of electricity and a
shreek of pain coming from the north.
25626.name: The Hallway.

description: You are walking down a long hallway within the department of City's
leaders floor.  Secretarys and politicians walk along this hall with you,
going to the mayor's offices.  The makou lights glare down at you from up on
the ceiling, and create an eerie atmosphere mixed with the shiny white
floor.  You can hear voices in all the offices, which probably means there
are meetings going on.
25124.name: A Long Hallway

description: The yellow walls, and the shiny, polished floor all send a pain through
your eyes as the light hits them.  Two oak doors stand north and south of
you, leading off into large and luxurious offices of the TriPower
executives.  There are afew memos and notices on the walls, but they don't
seem very interesting.  Office workers hustle and bustle around here as well
as some janitors.
25116.name: A Well Polished Hallway

description: You are in a small jail cell that is just big enough for a cot, some floor space for
excersizing and a privy.  You notice that there is a small window along the north wall
that is barred to keep the law breaker inside.  The walls are made of solid concrete
and are padded to prevent injury to ones self.
25459.name: Jail Cell: 13 Hotel

description: The room is extremly small, cramped and just about big enough for a
single person to squeeze themselves into the space allowed, otherwises
this closet is occupied by boxes, papers and supplies.  A ladder on
the opposite wall of the door disappears into the ceiling.
25991.name: Presidential Closet

description: You stand before the {YE{*le{&va{*to{Yr{x, the main transportation between each
floor of the tower.  You look around the room, and you see it is
plain, and looks like the rest of the lobby.  A few plants sit in the
corner, in silver pots.  You see two doors on either side of this
room, marked "Employee's Only".  The elevator doors stand to the
north, and the lobby back south.
25002.name: {*Before The {YE{*le{&va{*to{Yr{x

description: You are in a small jail cell that is just big enough for a cot, some floor space for
excersizing and a privy.  You notice that there is a small window along the north wall
that is barred to keep the law breaker inside.  The walls are made of solid concrete
and are padded to prevent injury to ones self.
25457.name: Jail Cell: 13 Echo

description: You are standing inside the TriPower Vault!  Large metallic shelves hold
piles upon piles of TriPower issue money, and even some gold and platinum
printed with the TriPower seal.  There is a security camera mounted atop one
of the shelves, so you better not get greedy and try to steal from here.
Only way back out is through the large vault door to your east.
25115.name: The TriPower Vault

description: This room is off limits to unauthorized personnel.  Through out the
Realms of Balance there are so many verities of plant life, and
occasionally a very dangerous plant is discovered, some are poisonous,
some give off ultrasound, and some even have a degree of intelligence.
Its best not to mess with stuff in this room, unless you really want to
play in the hangman tree.
25406.name: Dangerous Plants Room

description: You stand near the ticket booth of the station.  A large booth
stands here, with several people in them, handing out the train
tickets.  On the wall, you see the train times, and a map of the whole
National Railway.  The people in the ticket booth do not look too
happy, and the booths are no exactly clean.  The train station goes
south, and the platforms to the west.
25610.name: {RT{rri{Bp{bower {CG{crand {CC{central {*- {RT{ricket {RO{rffice{x

description: You stand in the National Library of the TriPower.  To either side
of you, the walls of books, and the knowledge within them, stands.  To
the south, you see the model of Torregiano, held under bright lights.
To the southeast and southwest, you see the reading tables.  And to
the north, the door to the Cannon Area.
25205.name: The National Library <Main>

description: Welcome to the City of Torregiano, city of technology, home of the
Tripower Empire, capital of the trade market, and many other things.
A large lounge stands before you, white walls with paintings, and
small gas lights giving light.  Several couches and chairs line the
room, and a large table sits in the middle of the room covered with
books and other items for reading.  A door to the east leads out to
the lobby of the Tripower Tower Complex, headquarters of the Tripower
Nation.  To the south of the lobby is the great city of Torregiano.

portal.
25320.name: {BP{bortal {BR{boom{x

description: You stand close to the center of the Library.  Here a large oak
table stands, with several gas lamps on it.  Some people sit at the
table, books open, and being quiet.  The center of the Library is
west.
25209.name: Reading Area

25270.name: Inside The End Of The Barrel

description: The tower is constructed from a dark grey marble,
carved from the lands of Deva, known for its valuable
minerals.  Each giant block was set in place with a
series of pullies and chains, lifted from the ground
below, weighing over several tons.  Cranes could now
make this job simple, but the tower was built while
the Tripower was young, along with technology.
25193.name: {GS{gouth-{GF{gace {&of the {RT{rri{Bp{bower {GT{gower{x

description: A large walkway stretches northwards to the center of the
Tripowerian Congressional Room.  The floor slowly lowers itself in
tiers until it reaches the large round stone podium in the center of
the room.  The outter walls are carved into pillars and form a dome
ceiling above.  Encompassing the podium in the center on each tier are
small deskes which are for the Senators to sit at, each of them with a
small makou gas lamp built into the corner.  These are the chambers in
which worldly decisions are made in by the Tripower Kingdom.
25229.name: {7The {CC{central {RC{ron{Bg{bressional {CW{calkway{x

description: You are in a small jail cell that is just big enough for a cot, some floor space for
excersizing and a privy.  You notice that there is a small window along the north wall
that is barred to keep the law breaker inside.  The walls are made of solid concrete
and are padded to prevent injury to ones self.
25455.name: Jail Cell: 13 Alpha

description: This is the western portion of the cafateria.  You notice that it is extremely loud
here.  Workers are here taking their breaks, and using that time to get something to
eat.  One thing that you notice is that there are children running around here,
creating a ruckus. They must be the kids of some of the people who work in the tower.
25434.name: Western Section of the Cafateria

description: This room is brightly lit and well guarded.  On the tiled floor there is a bright
yellow line painted, for used for walking prisoners to the jail cells to the north.
There are guards at each of the exit to keep people out, or in for that matter.
25436.name: Hallway Intersection

description: At the end of this hall lies the door to the Office of the
Secretary of Justice.  Two gorgeous murals that depict the greatest
moments in celestial hierarchy and law and the creation of immortal
order line both sides of the halls.  The obsidian statuettes that line
the halls represent the individual legendary law-givers of the Order
of Justice's ancestors, the Imperial Guards.  The door at the end of
this hall lies slightly open.
25082.name: Entrance to the Secretary's Office

description: You see the bookcases here are filled with large notebooks and
blueprints.  A small table stands infront of the case, a small model
of some makou cannons stand.  One is a cannon, built from a colliseum
arena.  The second, stands on three rings, that are supported above
the table.
25211.name: <Library> The Makou Cannon

description: You stand in a long and poorly lit hallway.  The walls are stone gray, as is the
floor, save for the bright yellow line that seems to have a glow of its own, that
runs down the center of the room.  You see exits leading in all directions, however
you notice that to the north and the south are jail cells.
25451.name: Western Cell Block

description: This portion of the cafateria's hallway is divided into to sections by a chain
barrier.  The walls are still the same pale blue, and you get the impression of
being back in school once again.  There is a counter along the east wall, with a
cashier standing behind it smiling at you, while the western half of the room is used
for those people who have finished eating and are on their way out the door.
25428.name: The Cashier's Counter

description: This room, is a large rectangular shaped room.  The four walls, and
ceiling are all made out of cold {8stone{x.  The floor, is wooden,
scrached and in terrible need of a good buffing.  Tables and cupboards
line the room, and are placed whever another can be crammed in.  On
these tables are things of all sorts, there are potions, vials, herbs,
scrolls, staves, trinkets, armor, makou gas containers, and of course
magic mushrooms.  There is but one man working in the room right now.
25319.name: {BM{bagical {BT{besting {&R{7oom{x

description: The Tripowerian Congress is home of the people's government of the
Tripower Kingdom.  The congress is made up of members called senators,
who help the government rule themselves.  The Congressional Room on
the 9th floor of the Tripower Tower is a large circular room built on
tiers.  The Podium that stands in the center of the room is sunk in,
while the Senator's Desks that circle the podium slowly rise tier per
tier as it extends away from the center.  The outter walls are carved
into pillars which meet up in a central dome.  South of the central
podium is a walkway leading to the tower elevators.
25273.name: {R[ {bC{*h{Yur{*c{bh {Yof {bD{Be{*s{yt{&r{yu{&c{Yt{*i{Bo{bn{x {R] {CS{cenator {CS{ceats{x

description: You are standing on the northern most platform.  Before you stands
the train platform.  You see the train tracks below you, running into
the underground tunnels of the station.  The platform seems to go in
either direction.  Pillars line the platforms just east of here, and
pass the pillars is the station.
{RTicket Booth:{rEAST{x
25611.name: TriPower TrainStation Platform [E]

description: Boxes and crates are piled up onto of each other here.  All stamped
with the same stamp:  {1[{BTri-Power{x: {!D{xept. {!O{xf {!A{xg.{1]{x
Some boxes hold maps, while others are filled with books about plants
and agriculture, while others still are heaping with plant and soil
samples.
25414.name: Store Room

description: You stand in the lobby {&+-----------------+{x of the TriPower Company.
The light gray floors    {&| {R###     ###     {&|{x extend in all directions.
In the center of the     {&| {R### ### ### ### {&|{x room, a large marble desk
stands, with a cute      {&| {R### ### ### ### {&|{x female behind it.  She
looks up at you, and     {&| {R### ### ### ### {&|{x smiles.  The room expands
outward in all direct-   {&| {R### ### ### ### {&|{x -ions.  The walls are made
up with brown molding    {&| {R### ### ### ### {&|{x with plaster centers. Gold
trim outlines everything.{&| {R    ###     ### {&|{x There are seats on either
side of the lobby,       {&+-----------------+{x sitting under varies lights
and pictures.  Back south{&| {GT R I P O W E R {&|{x the wall is made totally of
glass, overlooking the   {&+-----------------+{x southern end of Torregiano.
You notice bathrooms on either side of the lobby.  To the north, you can
see the elevator.
25001.name: {*T{3he L{*ob{&by {7of {*T{3he T{*ow{&er

description: Obviously this hallway is a bit of a toned down expanse of luxury.
It proceeds north to a large room and all of the walls are plastered
with grayish clay and tannish wallpaper.  A few portraits rest on the
walls but they are perfectly meaningless individuals.  Nothing special
seems to take part of this side of the directorate.
25077.name: A Very Plain Hallway

description: You enter the Presidental Lounge, an area for the president and
other staff members to sit and relax, and watch over the city.  To the
west the city of Torregiano stands before you, large windows look out
over the west side.  You see life goes on...  The room is made out of
a dark wood, which is on the walls.  The ceilings are made from the
same dark wood, and makou lights hang down.  The floor is covered in a
red carpet.  The walls are covered with pictures, paintings and flags.
The room is filled with tables, chairs, couches, and a small bar.
25993.name: The Presidental Lounge

description: The tower is constructed from a dark grey marble,
carved from the lands of Deva, known for its valuable
minerals.  Each giant block was set in place with a
series of pullies and chains, lifted from the ground
below, weighing over several tons.  Cranes could now
make this job simple, but the tower was built while
the Tripower was young, along with technology.
25220.name: {GS{gouth-{GF{gace {&of the {RT{rri{Bp{bower {GT{gower{x

description: This cove has the double doors leading to the Dept.  Of {!  R{1oads{2 &
{!  B{1ridges{0 to the east, and the elevator to the west.  On the wall on
either side of the doors are fine rederings of this Departments Finest
accomplishments.  A picture of the Market Square of Westbridge on the Right,
and the Center Bridge of Westbridge on the Left.  A Small plaque here shows
the current leadership of the Dept.
25500.name: Entrance to Dept. {!R{1oads {B& {!B{1ridges{0

description: You are standing in the northern section reserved for members of
the press. You see that the seats here are barely cushioned and
you also notice that the accoustics here are extremely good as
nobody wants the lacky reporters to twist everything thats said.
The floor here is tiled instead of carpeted to make it easier
to clean.
25462.name: Northern Section of the Audience

description: The Tripowerian Congress is home of the people's government of the
Tripower Kingdom.  The congress is made up of members called senators,
who help the government rule themselves.  The Congressional Room on
the 9th floor of the Tripower Tower is a large circular room built on
tiers.  The Podium that stands in the center of the room is sunk in,
while the Senator's Desks that circle the podium slowly rise tier per
tier as it extends away from the center.  The outter walls are carved
into pillars which meet up in a central dome.  South of the central
podium is a walkway leading to the tower elevators.
25240.name: {R[{C Outlaws {R] {CS{cenator {CS{ceats{x

description: You stand infront of a counter.  Within the counter you see diffrent
{rdaggers{x and {Rknives{x of the trade.  Behind the counter an even larger
counter opens up to reveal {Rsw{ror{Rds{x of all {Mkinds{x and {msizes{x.  A man sits
behind the counter, waiting for you to say something to him.  To the
north, you see the {Yaccessories{x area of the store.
25038.name: {*The {YG{yr{&a{yn{Yd {RS{rtore {CW{Best{c [Weapons]{x

description: |       THE TRIPOWER TOWER COMPLEX         |
| The tower uses alot of Mob Programs,     |
| which makes your visit just a little     |
| more interesting than most areas. Floors |
| 1-10 are public, and no one can get      |
| passed the 10th floor without a security |
| pass. If you want to see the President,  |
| Just say 19th in the room with Beth. She |
| will transfer you to Nicki, where you    |
| will read a sign that explains Nicki's   |
| Mob Programs. Also you can see see the   |
| President by talking to Sidney on the    |
| 5th Floor East Wing.                     |
You are finally before the huge glass elevator you saw on your way up the
stairs.  A couple couches and other pieces of furniture are lined up against
the white-painted walls, put there for you to sit on while you wait for the
elevator.  A large ding is heard as the elevator comes down to the floor you
are on.  Its now safe to go in.  Exits are south, and north into the
elevator.  A sign hangs on the floor.  If you want to see the president i
would read it.  (LOOK SIGN).
25023.name: The Reception Hall Of The Tower

is built with the same standard white walls, marble floor as the rest
of the building.  The floor and walls themselves appear to be giving
off more than enough light to comfortably see.
25318.name: {&N{7orthern {&H{7allway{x

description: This hallway runs North to South, it is long, high ceilinged, and
is built with the same standard white walls, marble floor as the rest
of the building.  The floor and walls themselves appear to be giving
off more than enough light to comfortably see.
25317.name: {&S{7outhern {&H{7allway{x

description: The bookcase here is marked by small flags.  In the bookcase you
see a Tripower flag, an Empire Of Sephiroth flag, and a Vector Flag.
Under each shelf with the flags, has a ton of books.  You see some
titles like "Vectorian Ways".
25217.name: <Library> Government Knowledge

description: The tower is constructed from a dark grey marble,
carved from the lands of Deva, known for its valuable
minerals.  Each giant block was set in place with a
series of pullies and chains, lifted from the ground
below, weighing over several tons.  Cranes could now
make this job simple, but the tower was built while
the Tripower was young, along with technology.
25221.name: {GS{gouth-{GF{gace {&of the {RT{rri{Bp{bower {GT{gower{x

description: A Hall here leads into the Department of Roads and Bridges, the walls are
covered in renderings of the Cities of the Tri-Power, Stonebow Dale on the
north wall, and Ofcal on the south wall.  Doors to various offices are here,
Office of Research and Developement to the east, Office of Road Repair to
the South, and Office of Bridge Repair to the North.
25507.name: Short Hall

description: The small entrance room is not very essentric.  {&White washed {xwalls
lead the way down three hallways, in a T shaped pattern.  The Elevator
is back to the east.

description: This is the Basement of the Tripower tower.  It looks as if no one
has been here for a long time.  Many spider webs gather in every
corner available.  It smells of old water and mildew, not a fun place
to be.
25616.name: {RT{rri{Bp{bower {CC{complex {RT{rower {cBasement{x

description: You stand on the southern most platform of the station.  Before you
stands the train platform.  You see the train tracks below you,
running into the underground tunnels of the station.  The platform
seems to go in either direction.  Pillars line the platforms just east
of here, and pass the pillars is the station.
25621.name: TriPower TrainStation Platform [A]

description: This is the Basement of the Tripower tower.  It looks as if no one
has been here for a long time.  Many spider webs gather in every
corner available.  It smells of old water and mildew, not a fun place
to be.
25608.name: {RT{rri{Bp{bower {CC{complex {RT{rower {cBasement{x

description: |  APPOINTMENTS ONLY TO SEE THE PRESIDENT  |
|  To Make An Appointment Ask (Using Say)  |
|  the secretary if the president is free. |
|  From there you will either be denied    |
| or gain access to President Bloodstoner. |
| The President's Secretary uses a list of |
| triggers to let you see the president.   |
| Say the following in the exact text and  |
| caps as shown...                         |
| "{Cmay i see the president{c"                |
| It must be in lower caps. The Secretary  |
| will disappear, and the president will   |
| either say yes or no, The Secretary will |
| tell you. If the president is in, then   |
| say "{Cthank-you{x" and you will be          |
| transfered. If the secretary didn't let  |
| you in, and you pop into the room, you   |
| will be slayed and no corpse returned.   |
| To leave the floor back to the reception |
| hall just say "{Ccya{x".                     |
| NOTE: Letter Size DOES Count!!           |
| -= Nisstyre =-                           |
{RNOTICE: If The Secretary Does Not Come Back
Then That Means Nisstyre Is Not Online Or
In His Office. Leave if this happens.{x
Before you stands a large hall, circular in shape.  Large stone
pillars surround the room, each with a small cove inbetween the next
pillar.  Within the alcoves are relics and models.  A few suits of
Legion Armor, a model of the Cannon and Airship.  Paintings of past
wars, A Magitek Armor's arm.  Each being lit by makou gas.  The floor
is brightly polished with the symbol of the Tripower in the middle,
the Four Bars.  An opening north leads into another room.  Two doors
stand on either side of the room, and the elevator back south.
25990.name: The Hall Of The Tripower

description: You are walking down a light gray hallways.  The walls have diffrent
pictures.  A few plants lay on the tables.  To the north you see a door that
reads "Dept Of Advise" and to the south you see a door that reasd "Dept.  Of
Safty".  To the east a large door stands, with the words on it "Citizen's
Relations President, Sidney Deadwillow".
25303.name: Hallway

description: A neat and tidy office, a desk in the center of the room sits devoid of
any paperwork, or clutter, a map on the wall is highlited with all the
bridges of the Tri-Power, little marker flags are pinned to the top of the
map, not marking anything in particular.  A hole can be seen where a pin was
in the center of Westbridge, but it has been removed now.
25503.name: Office of Bridge Repair

description: The whole room is full glass tubes and hoses.  They run from water
tanks to plant food and into large trays growing plants with out soil.
There are no windows here.  The room is lit with a different form of
makou gas lamp, one designed specially for growing plants.  A man runs
about the lab with a clip board constantly checking dials, buttons and
plants, making sure everything is perfect for growing what ever it is he
is growing.   Hmm it smells like someone let a skunk in here.
25404.name: Hydroponics Lab

description: The Tripowerian Congress is home of the people's government of the
Tripower Kingdom.  The congress is made up of members called senators,
who help the government rule themselves.  The Congressional Room on
the 9th floor of the Tripower Tower is a large circular room built on
tiers.  The Podium that stands in the center of the room is sunk in,
while the Senator's Desks that circle the podium slowly rise tier per
tier as it extends away from the center.  The outter walls are carved
into pillars which meet up in a central dome.  South of the central
podium is a walkway leading to the tower elevators.
25237.name: {R[{C Apostles of the Crypt {R] {CS{cenator {CS{ceats{x

description: This room has a beautiful view of the Harbor and Sea stretching out
across the northern side of the city, The room's inner 2 walls are a mass of
pigeon holes filled with maps from across the realms.  A massive table sits
here with charting stations on four sides, each labels with a section of the
Realms, Northern, Southern, Eastern and Western.
25502.name: Cartographers Office

description: The Tripowerian Congress is home of the people's government of the
Tripower Kingdom.  The congress is made up of members called senators,
who help the government rule themselves.  The Congressional Room on
the 9th floor of the Tripower Tower is a large circular room built on
tiers.  The Podium that stands in the center of the room is sunk in,
while the Senator's Desks that circle the podium slowly rise tier per
tier as it extends away from the center.  The outter walls are carved
into pillars which meet up in a central dome.  South of the central
podium is a walkway leading to the tower elevators.
25238.name: {R[ {rA{Rpo{yst{Yles o{yf S{Run{re{x {R] {CS{cenator {CS{ceats{x

description: A corner office with a view, except all the windows have been painted
black and scralled upon ...  IT is a Map!!...  White chaulk marks room upon
room starting from a chalkboard on the wall and extending a third of the way
alone the next two walls.  Many of the last rooms are marked with skull and
crossbones.  Other various papers are neatly stacked in four piles, each
labeled, Wimpy, Aggresive killers, Aggresive Murderers, And Death.
25505.name: Map Room for Underdark Alternative

description: This is the Basement of the Tripower tower.  It looks as if no one
has been here for a long time.  Many spider webs gather in every
corner available.  It smells of old water and mildew, not a fun place
to be.
25604.name: {RT{rri{Bp{bower {RT{rower {CS{cewage {CD{crains {CM{caintenance {CR{coom{x

description: Here, you see another section with newer books.  The books here are
almost new, and some old.  You see the words "Mako Energy" on it, an
employee stands, reading a book called "What is Mako".
25219.name: <Library> Mako Energy

description: Two large doors stands to the north, well made doors with
engravings all around the doorframe.  Behind the doors is the office
of the ruler of the Tripower, Lord Bloodstoner, also god of
Nightmares.  Two well armed guards stand in front of each door,
watching your every moves.
25090.name: The Doors Of Lord Bloodstoner

description: You have entered the office of the famed Merchant Jaal WhiteFeather.  He
controls the department of Federal banks and mints as a side job to his
Leadership of the Dragon's Hoard.  A huge cedar desk stands at the
southernmost part of the room.  On it are stacks and stacks of papers, that
he has to review and sign.  The skylights of the room allow you to see the
sun in the day, and the stars at night.  A jacuzzi is installed on the
eastern part of the room, there for Jaal's amusement.  A huge picture of a
grassy meadow is hung across the whole western wall.  The only exit is
south.
25103.name: Jaal's Office

description: You stand at a small corner in the train station.  To the north is
the Ticket Booths.  To the northwest, west and southwest is the train
platform.  To the south you see the station, which is empty and dark.
To the east you see some seats for sitting, and bathrooms.
{RSeating Area:{r EAST
{RTicket Booth: {r NORTH{x
25613.name: {RT{rri{Bp{bower {CG{crand {CC{central {*- {RN{rorth {RP{rlatform{x

description: You stand in the large, no-so-clean train station bathroom.
Several private stalls stand to the west, most of there doors closed,
and a nice stench of shit leaking out from them.  To the east you see
some sinks, with the urinals next to them.  Some people have mistaken
the sinks for a toilet.  The floor isn't clean, dirt, blood, and other
fluids you don't want to think about cover the floor.
25609.name: TriPower Station Bathroom

description: There is a long line in this hallway, mostly people in orange uniforms
with black numbers across the back.  Many are just standing here, but many
are also throwing a fit.  On man to the south throws out a scream, "I didn't
do it, It's all a lie!  I was set up!"  .  To the west is the Lethal
Injection chamber and to the north is the Electric chair...
25631.name: The Hall to the Two Chambers.

description: A large staircase curves upwards into the 20th floor of the tower.
On the 20th Floor is the Presidential Office, and the ruler known as
Lord Bloodstoner.  The top of the stairs disappears into the 20th
floor.
25087.name: Presidential Hall: East Staircase

stands a large open court, with several shops surrounding the outter
walls.  Kind of like a public shopping area.  Citizens of the city
walk around, shopping and sitting down as small tables through-out the
lobby.  It looks like a very active area.  To the north, you see a
flight of stairs going up to the government offices.
25007.name: {*Second Floor {yL{*o{&b{*b{yy{x

description: You stand close to the center of the Library.  Here a large oak
table stands, with several gas lamps on it.  Some people sit at the
table, books open, and being quiet.  The center of the Library is
east.
25210.name: Reading Area

description: Here lies the reception lobby of the Department of Justice.  A
circular room ringed pentagonally by eight grand marble pillars and
connected by halls of ivory and alabaster to all points of the
compass.  A beautiful bronze casting of the sun ornately caps the
ceiling and a large red and black-barred TriPower flag drapes from the
center.  The secretary at the desk appears to busy to take note of
visitors or anyone who roams the halls.
25075.name: Lobby of the {!D{1epart. {!O{1f {!J{1ustice{x.

description: You are in a big warehouse filled with crates of
stuff to be sold in other countries. You notice some
confused workers trying to figure out what to do with
a box that says "This side up" on all of the sides.
You feel very sorry for them.
25421.name: Corner of the Exports Warehouse

description: This is the Basement of the Tripower tower.  It looks as if no one
has been here for a long time.  Many spider webs gather in every
corner available.  It smells of old water and mildew, not a fun place
to be.

behind it.  The lady sits on a stool, opening books, stamping them,
and closing them.  The walls around here are filled with pictures and
"notes".  She looks pretty busy.
25218.name: <Library> Librarian's Corner

description: You are in a small jail cell that is just big enough for a cot, some floor space for
excersizing and a privy.  You notice that the only window in this room is the one
located on the door, but that is barred so to keep the criminals in.  The walls are
made of solid concrete and are padded to prevent injury to ones self.
25448.name: Jail Cell: 13 Delta

description: You are in a small jail cell that is just big enough for a cot, some floor space for
excersizing and a privy.  You notice that there is a small window along the north wall
that is barred to keep the law breaker inside.  The walls are made of solid concrete
and are padded to prevent injury to ones self.
25458.name: Jail Cell: 13 Foxtrot

description: You walk past the plaque, and onto a shiny and well polished floor.  The
walls are still painted bright green, which probably is a reference to what
they deal in here.  Another sign up ahead announces that this side of the
department is where they handle the money.  A few office workers walk around
you, on some errand or task.  EXits lead east and west.
25102.name: The Department of Banks

description: Filing cabinets line this small room.  And on top of the cabinets are
more files, and more on the floor.  Even some are tacked to the walls.
Every thing the Department has researched, written or copied is
somewhere in here.  Good luck finding anything.
25413.name: File Room

description: The Tripowerian Congress is home of the people's government of the
Tripower Kingdom.  The congress is made up of members called senators,
who help the government rule themselves.  The Congressional Room on
the 9th floor of the Tripower Tower is a large circular room built on
tiers.  The Podium that stands in the center of the room is sunk in,
while the Senator's Desks that circle the podium slowly rise tier per
tier as it extends away from the center.  The outter walls are carved
into pillars which meet up in a central dome.  South of the central
podium is a walkway leading to the tower elevators.
25271.name: {R[ {MCh{murc{*h of S{mtri{Mfe{x {R] {CS{cenator {CS{ceats{x

description: This is a large circular room.  The walls do no differ, but the floor
is made up of hundereds of summoning stones, all intracately lain out.
To form a very immaculate summoning circle.  The circle is huge, and
so carefully created that even a minor enchanter could summon a monster
like the great Moleydus Lord of the Greater Tanar'ri, yet not have
to worry.
25321.name: {BS{bummoning {BC{bhamber{c

25032.name: {GT{ghe {RE{rlevator{g of the {RT{rower{x

description: You stand in the middle of {rfour{x large racks.  Each rack holds a good
{C50 {&shirts{x.  All diffrent types of {&shirts{x hang here, from just plain
shirts, to the very dressed up shirts for going out.  The store
extends in almost all directions, leading to the diffrent {Rsections{x.
25042.name: {*The {YG{yr{&a{yn{Yd {RS{rtore {CE{Bast{c [Shirts]{x

description: The room here is filled with cubicles.  A large group of people are
here going about the daily business of the department.  Mostly filling
out paperwork, or filling in maps.  A group of people are in the corner
obsessing over a new plant they have found, something they call
Cannabis, how odd.
25407.name: Main Work Room

description: This enormous room is the central processing center for all of the
Tri-Power's legal transactions, criminal records, arrest reports, and
other blotter-like information.  Everything and anything pertaining to
law and criminal justice will see this room and be filed away for
several decades.  A dozen workers tirelessly file away thousands of
pieces of information every day.
25081.name: The Document Room

description: You have gotten past the guard and are now in a nicely polished hallway.
The walls are painted a pleasant yellow, probably to represent gold.  There
is a large plaque on the wall to your right, on it, it explained that this
part of the department is where the money is stamped and printed.  Exits go
west and east.
25101.name: The Federal Mint

description: This Seems to be a waiting room of some sort.  Many people sit in chairs
here, crying, sobing, or just sitting there solemly know what is about to
happen.  As the lights flicker and dim, a large hum of electricity is heard
and a scream is emitted.
25628.name: The Wating room.

description: The bookcases here are filled with old, smelly books.  You see the
World History bookcase, the place you can find almost anything you
want on the history of the world.  To the south, you see another
section.
25214.name: <Library> World History

description: The tower is constructed from a dark grey marble,
carved from the lands of Deva, known for its valuable
minerals.  Each giant block was set in place with a
series of pullies and chains, lifted from the ground
below, weighing over several tons.  Cranes could now
make this job simple, but the tower was built while
the Tripower was young, along with technology.
25197.name: {GS{gouth-{GF{gace {&of the {RT{rri{Bp{bower {GT{gower{x

description: You are standing in the very center of the Council Room.  As you look
around you see that the entire room is almost shaped like a bowl, with
this being the lowest part.  The carpeting here is blood red with grey
patterns.  In the center of the room there is a huge table, with enough
seats for all the heads of each department.  At the head of the table
sits a large and ornate chair, which is reserved for the President or
his assign representative.
25461.name: Center of the Council Meeting Hall

description: The tower is constructed from a dark grey marble,
carved from the lands of Deva, known for its valuable
minerals.  Each giant block was set in place with a
series of pullies and chains, lifted from the ground
below, weighing over several tons.  Cranes could now
make this job simple, but the tower was built while
the Tripower was young, along with technology.
25187.name: {GS{gouth-{GF{gace {&of the {RT{rri{Bp{bower {GT{gower{x

description: You enter a large room.  To the east and west is a large staircase
that leads up to the next floor, in which Lord Bloodstoner rules of
the Tripower.  Under the next floor, inbetween the stairs is the
reception's desk.  Here in the waiting room there is a few chairs, and
a round couch.  To the east and west is the staircases.
25992.name: The Presidential Waiting Room

description: A large room filled with desks full of papers, shelves full of books, and
people scurrying around, looks as if a new project is under way and they are
all working hard to make it happen.  There is an office door to the east,
and another to the north.  Tne northern door is guarded by a large treant.
25508.name: Office of R&D

description: This is the Basement of the Tripower tower.  It looks as if no one
has been here for a long time.  Many spider webs gather in every
corner available.  It smells of old water and mildew, not a fun place
to be.
25602.name: {RT{rri{Bp{bower {RT{rower {CM{cakou {CG{cas {CM{caintenance {CR{coom{x

description: Two little gnomes are here, stumbling through the dark trying to grow a
wide variety of fungus, and mushrooms.  The room is very stuffy as there
is no circulation, it also smells very musty, who knows how the gnomes
can take being in this room.
25402.name: Darkroom

description: This small cozy little room, is dimly lit.  The sweet smell of honeydew
sifts around the room.  The room is not decorated but there is a lounge
couch, a small table, and an icebox.  No sounds from the outside world
seem to penetrate into this peacefull little getaway.
25315.name: {&H{7idden {&L{7ounge{x

description: The tower is constructed from a dark grey marble,
carved from the lands of Deva, known for its valuable
minerals.  Each giant block was set in place with a
series of pullies and chains, lifted from the ground
below, weighing over several tons.  Cranes could now
make this job simple, but the tower was built while
the Tripower was young, along with technology.
25222.name: Above the {RT{rri{Bp{bower {GP{glaza{x

description: You enter the back halls of the tower, a restricted area that is
only open to those who are {YT{yo{&w{ye{Yr {yEm{Yploy{yee's {RO{rnl{Ry{x.  The hall is
somewhat small, and goes to the north.  Back south is a door leading
to the {YG{yr{&a{yn{Yd {RS{rtore{x.
25010.name: {YT{yo{&w{ye{Yr {yEm{Yploy{yee's {RO{rnl{Ry{x

description: The Tripowerian Congress is home of the people's government of the
Tripower Kingdom.  The congress is made up of members called senators,
who help the government rule themselves.  The Congressional Room on
the 9th floor of the Tripower Tower is a large circular room built on
tiers.  The Podium that stands in the center of the room is sunk in,
while the Senator's Desks that circle the podium slowly rise tier per
tier as it extends away from the center.  The outter walls are carved
into pillars which meet up in a central dome.  South of the central
podium is a walkway leading to the tower elevators.
25272.name: {R[ {*Shadow Thieves{x {R] {CS{cenator {CS{ceats{x
